qas.question: At what point did the Mesozoic era begin?
What kind of geologic activity occurred during the Mesozoic?
Besides climate changes, what other important activity occurred during the Mesozoic?
When mamals appeared they remained small until what period?
At what point did the Mesozoic era end?
The Mesozoic was a time devoid of what activity?
What quickly split the supercontinent Pangea into landmasses?
Non-avian dinosaurs disappeared in what period?
Birds devolved from what branch of dinosaurs?

context: The era began in the wake of the <a0_0><b5_0>Permian–Triassic<b5_0/> extinction<a0_0/> event, the largest well-documented mass extinction in Earth's history, and ended with the <a1_0>Cretaceous–Paleogene extinction<a1_0/> event, another mass extinction which is known for having killed off non-avian dinosaurs, as well as other plant and animal species. The Mesozoic was a time of significant <a2_0>tectonic<a2_0/>, climate and <a3_0><b6_0>evolutionary<b6_0/><a3_0/> activity. The era witnessed the gradual <b7_0>rifting<b7_0/> of the supercontinent Pangaea into separate landmasses that would eventually move into their current positions. The climate of the Mesozoic was varied, alternating between warming and cooling periods. Overall, however, the Earth was hotter than it is today. Non-avian dinosaurs appeared in the <b8_0>Late Triassic<b8_0/> and became the dominant terrestrial vertebrates early in the Jurassic, occupying this position for about 135 million years until their demise at the end of the Cretaceous. Birds first appeared in the Jurassic, having evolved from a branch of <b9_0>theropod<b9_0/> dinosaurs. The first mammals also appeared during the Mesozoic, but would remain small—less than 15 kg (33 lb)—until the <a4_0>Cenozoic<a4_0/>.
